meanings.definition: To withdraw or disavow a statement or belief.
meanings.sent1: After realizing his mistake, he was recanting his earlier claim.
meanings.sent2: She was recanting her support for the controversial policy.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be recanting its decision to chase the mouse.
meanings.sent4: The storm recanting its fierce winds, leaving behind a calm evening.
meanings.sent5: Recanting his promise, he left her waiting in the rain.

meanings.definition: The act of retracting a previous statement or belief.
meanings.sent1: Her recanting of the accusation caused a stir in the courtroom.
meanings.sent2: The recanting of his confession raised doubts about the case.
meanings.sent3: The recanting of the weather forecast led to unexpected sunshine.
meanings.sent4: The recanting of the contract left both parties in a dilemma.
meanings.sent5: The recanting of the theory opened up new possibilities for research.
